item.title: The Waiting Room: 7 Comedies to Stream While Waiting for “Shrinking” Season 3
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
Missing "Shrinking"? From "Ted Lasso" to "After Life," here are 7 comedies with the same therapeutic vibe to stream while you wait for Season 3.

The post The Waiting Room: 7 Comedies to Stream While Waiting for “Shrinking” Season 3 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Managing Editor Mike Strayer, who has covered TV and entertainment for over 11 years.

We all know the feeling: You’ve binge-watched every episode of Shrinking, you’ve fallen in love with Harrison Ford’s grumpy mentorship, and you’re rooting for Jimmy to get his life together. But Season 3 isn’t here yet, and you have a comedy-shaped hole in your heart.
If you love the mix of psychological insight, messy protagonists, and laugh-out-loud grief processing, you don’t have to wait. Here are seven shows that scratch that same therapeutic itch—ranging from the classics to hidden gems.

1. “Ted Lasso” (Apple TV)

The vibe: Relentless optimism meets emotional baggage.

Why it fits: Let’s get the obvious one out of the way first. “Shrinking” co-creators Bill Lawrence and Brett Goldstein are the masterminds here, too. While “Shrinking” focuses on mental health professionals, “Ted Lasso” focuses on sports, but the DNA is identical. It’s about broken men, father figures, and the power of radical kindness. If you haven’t seen it, this is your mandatory homework.

2. “Frasier” (Paramount+)

The vibe: High-brow neuroses and slapstick misunderstandings.

Why it fits: Before Jimmy Laird started “Jimmy-ing” his patients, there was Dr. Frasier Crane. If you appreciate the “therapist who can’t take his own advice” trope, this is the gold standard. While “Shrinking” is modern and messy, “Frasier” is witty and theatrical (though one could argue the new seasons of the “Frasier” reboot get pretty dirty), and both delve deep into the comedic side of psychology and family dynamics.

3. “Scrubs” (Hulu)

The vibe: Life, death, and eagle antics.

Why it fits: Another Bill Lawrence classic. If you love the dynamic between Jimmy (Jason Segel) and Paul (Harrison Ford), you need to witness the original blueprint: J.D. and Dr. Cox. “Scrubs” mastered the art of pivoting from a goofy fantasy sequence to a devastatingly sad moment in the blink of an eye. It balances the weight of a medical profession with pure absurdity.

4. “After Life” (Netflix)

The vibe: Cynical grief with a heart of gold.

Why it fits: Jimmy acts out because he is grieving his wife; Tony (Ricky Gervais) does the same thing in “After Life.” Tony decides to punish the world by saying precisely what he thinks. It is darker and more cynical than “Shrinking,” but it explores the same question: How do you keep living when your person is gone?

5. “Loudermilk” (Netflix)

The vibe: Grumpy irreverence in a church basement.

Why it fits: Sam Loudermilk is a substance abuse counselor who is incredibly bad at people skills but oddly good at his job. A CableTV.com all-time favorite, the show centers on a support group of misfits who form a dysfunctional family. If you love the ensemble cast of patients in “Shrinking,” the group dynamics in “Loudermilk” will feel right at home.

6. “The Good Place” (Netflix)

The vibe: Moral philosophy with a side of frozen yogurt.

Why it fits: “Shrinking” is ultimately about people trying to be better. “The Good Place” takes that concept literally. It follows four people trying to navigate the afterlife to prove they are “good.” It’s bright, vibrant, deeply concerned with ethics and self-improvement, and absolutely hilarious.

7. “Somebody Somewhere” (HBO Max)

The vibe: Midwestern melancholy and joy.

Why it fits: This is a quieter, more grounded pick. It follows Sam, who is dealing with a midlife crisis and the death of her sister. She finds her “people” in a local choir practice. It captures the specific “Shrinking” feeling of finding joy and laughter amid profound sadness, highlighting the importance of a “found family.”

Related articles

  • The Best Streaming Services
  • What to Watch on Apple TV+
  • TV Shows Like Ted Lasso

The post The Waiting Room: 7 Comedies to Stream While Waiting for “Shrinking” Season 3 appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: NBA Schedule This Week: Best Games To Watch & TV Schedule (Week 14)
item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
CableTV.com's NBA expert maps out the weekly TV schedule and breaks down the top games for Jan. 12–18, including storylines so you know exactly what to watch.

The post NBA Schedule This Week: Best Games To Watch & TV Schedule (Week 14) appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve hit the dog days of the NBA season. Post-Christmas, pre-All-Star break is a weird time, when weird things happen. Essentially, all eyes are on the trade deadline on February 5.

But! There’s still plenty of NBA action that’s fun and matters. I’ve picked two must-watch games and compiled the entire Week 14 TV schedule below.

Jump to:

  • National NBA game of the week
  • NBA League Pass game of the week
  • NBA schedule this week
  • League news and analysis

National NBA game of the week

Los Angeles Lakers at Los Angeles Clippers | Amazon Prime Video

The battle for LA is always compelling.

Until recently, the Clippers have dominated this matchup. There was a stretch where they won 11 straight games against the Lakers and made an argument that they were no longer the lesser of the two teams.

But in the last couple of years, the Lakers have retaken that crown.

This matchup, though, will include Luka Doncic. He’ll suit up with LeBron James, Kawhi Leonard, James Harden, and Bradley Beal. That’s a ton of star power on the court at the same time.

How to watch Los Angeles Lakers vs. Los Angeles Clippers

Date: Thursday, Jan. 22
Time: 10:00 p.m. ET
National channel: Amazon Prime Video
Location: Intuit Dome, Inglewood, CA

Stream on Prime Video

Honorable mention: 

  • New York Knicks at Philadelphia 76ers (Saturday, Jan. 24, 3:00 p.m. ET, ABC)

NBA League Pass game of the week

Cleveland Cavaliers at Orlando Magic | NBA League Pass

The Cavs are finally starting to look like the championship contender so many thought they would be.

Darius Garland returned to the lineup and started playing like his old self, and Donovan Mitchell has continued to have an excellent year. Jaylon Tyson and Evan Mobley have also come in clutch in big moments. Unfortunately, Garland hurt his right toe and is out for at least a week.

The Magic, as of this writing, have an almost identical record to Cleveland. Orlando is in the sixth and final playoff spot, and the Cavs are currently in the play-in at the seventh seed.

This game, and any others between them for the remainder of the season, will have huge postseason implications. Plus, the Magic are in dire need of a win against a team that matters.

How to watch Cleveland Cavaliers at Orlando Magic

Date: Saturday, Jan. 24
Time: 7:00 p.m. ET
Local channels: FDSOH, FDSFL
Out-of-market: NBA League Pass
Location: Kia Center, Orlando, FL

Try NBA League Pass

Honorable mention: 

  • Toronto Raptors at Golden State Warriors (Tuesday, Jan. 20, 10:00 p.m. ET)

Full NBA schedule for Jan. 19–25

I think you’ll love the games I’ve recommended above. But if not, check out the table below. I’ve mapped out the entire Week 13 NBA TV schedule so you don’t have to waste time searching for it.

Matchup Day Time (ET) Channel

New York Knicks at Philadelphia 76ers Saturday, Jan. 24 3:00 p.m. ABC
Golden State Warriors at Minnesota Timberwolves Saturday, Jan. 24 5:30 p.m. ABC

Cleveland Cavaliers at Orlando Magic Saturday, Jan. 24 7:00 p.m. FDSFL, FDSOH, NBA League Pass
Boston Celtics at Chicago Bulls Saturday, Jan. 24 8:00 p.m. CHSN, NBC Sports Boston, NBA League Pass
Los Angeles Lakers at Dallas Mavericks Saturday, Jan. 24 8:30 p.m. ABC
Miami Heat at Utah Jazz Saturday, Jan. 24 9:30 p.m. KJZZ-TV, Jazz+, FDSSUN, NBA League Pass
Sacramento Kings at Detroit Pistons Sunday, Jan. 25 3:00 p.m. FDSDET, NBC Sports California, NBA League Pass
Denver Nuggets at Memphis Grizzlies Sunday, Jan. 25 3:30 p.m. FDSSE, Altitude 2 Sports, NBA League Pass
Dallas Mavericks at Milwaukee Bucks Sunday, Jan. 25 7:00 p.m. FDSWI, KFAA-TV, Mavs.com, NBA League Pass
Toronto Raptors at Oklahoma City Thunder Sunday, Jan. 25 7:00 p.m. FDSOK, NBA League Pass, TSN
New Orleans Pelicans at San Antonio Spurs Sunday, Jan. 25 7:00 p.m. FDSSW, GCSEN, Pelicans.com, NBA League Pass
Miami Heat at Phoenix Suns Sunday, Jan. 25 8:00 p.m. Arizona's Family 3TV, Suns Live, FDSSUN, NBA League Pass
Brooklyn Nets at Los Angeles Clippers Sunday, Jan. 25 9:00 p.m. FDSSC, YES, NBA League Pass

Data effective as of post date.

Swishes and airballs: My hot takes from NBA Week 13

There was nothing overly exciting (at least to me) about the league last week, but there were still a couple of things to highlight.

Airball: Jonathan Kuminga’s trade demand. Everyone knows he’s wanted out for a while. There was that prolonged contract negotiation before the start of the season.

More importantly, he’s been in and out of the rotation and hasn’t even played since mid-December. So why is he a big deal? Why is he acting as though he’s a star player whose demands matter? It’s just kind of entitled, if you ask me.

Swish: The Golden State Warriors. The fading dynasty won all three games last week, and one of those was against the Knicks. As of this writing, they’ve won seven of their last 10 games. They’re still in the play-in race, but there’s a lot of season left and not much separation from the top six in the Western Conference.

NBA schedule this week FAQ

When does the NBA season end?

The 2025–2026 NBA season ends Sunday, April 12, 2026.

How many games are in an NBA season?

The NBA season officially has 82 games. But since the addition of the NBA Cup, that number is technically 83 for the two teams that advance to the championship game of that tournament. The championship game doesn’t count as a regular-season game.

When is the NBA trade deadline?

The NBA trade deadline for the 2025–2026 season is February 5, 2026, at 3:00 p.m. ET.

Where can I watch Inside the NBA?

Inside the NBA will air on ABC and ESPN throughout the season. It will also include the show’s signature pregame and halftime shows.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports writer, Alex Vejar, is a passionate NBA fan who follows the league by watching multiple games per week. He analyzed the NBA schedule and made his viewing recommendations based on matchups, star power, style of play, and unique or interesting viewing experiences.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods for reviewing TV services.

Game day starts here!

  • I Calculated the Cost of Watching the NBA on TV
  • How To Watch NBA Games on TV
  • How To Watch the NBA Without Cable
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

The post NBA Schedule This Week: Best Games To Watch & TV Schedule (Week 14) appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: 8 Peter Pan Movies Ranked: From “Hook” to The Classics
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
From the 1953 Disney classic to Steven Spielberg's Hook, we rank the eight best Peter Pan movies of all time. See which trip to Neverland takes the top spot.

The post 8 Peter Pan Movies Ranked: From “Hook” to The Classics appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Peter Pan has a long history of refusing to grow up. And Hollywood refuses to let him rest, either.

With J.M. Barrie’s original works entering the public domain in 2024, the floodgates are open for even more trips to Neverland. But this isn’t just a recent obsession. The boy who wouldn’t grow up has been captivating audiences since Barrie first debuted the character in The Little White Bird (1902). From there, the mythos grew into a cultural phenomenon through the 1904 West End play and the 1911 novelization, Peter and Wendy.

From silent films to David Lowery’s recent Peter Pan & Wendy on Disney+, filmmakers love to reimagine this story. Whether you want gritty realism or Technicolor magic, there’s a version for you. I’ve rounded up the fan-favorite films worth revisiting, ranking the best Peter Pan movies that explore Neverland from every angle.

Watch our original recommendations on TikTok!

8. Wendy (2020)

Beasts of the Southern Wild director Benh Zeitlin reimagines the classic tale through a raw, unvarnished lens. His version centers on Wendy and a ragtag group of children living on a mysterious island where aging is a conscious choice. The movie strips away the pixie dust and polished costumes for a more elemental look at youth and freedom. It’s a polarizing, poetic interpretation that treats the myth less like a fairy tale and more like a fever dream.

7. Pan (2015)

Joe Wright’s prequel attempts to explain how Peter got to Neverland in the first place, pitting him against Hugh Jackman’s theatrical Blackbeard. While the movie was a critical misfire, it’s a fascinating spectacle that swings for the fences with flying pirate ships and a cover of Nirvana’s “Smells Like Teen Spirit.” Pan is a wild, weird reimagining that deserves a watch just for its sheer audacity and visual inventiveness.

6. Peter Pan & Wendy (2023)

I was genuinely looking forward to David Lowery’s take on the source material. After all, he did a solid job with Pete’s Dragon and was fresh off the excellent fantasy adventure The Green Knight. But while Peter Pan & Wendy has its positives, it doesn’t quite stand out against the sea of other adaptations. The undeniable bright spot is Jude Law, who plays a terrifyingly weary Captain Hook. It seems like whoever takes on that role has a jolly ol’ time, and Law is no exception.

5. Return to Never Land (2002)

I’ll be the first to admit that Disney’s animated sequels were very hit or miss back in the day, but Return to Never Land is a genuine standout. The movie shifts the focus to Wendy’s daughter, Jane, a pragmatic girl growing up during the London Blitz who has no time for her mother’s “nonsense” stories. It’s a surprisingly touching film about the loss of innocence and the necessity of hope in dark times. With polished animation and a strong emotional core, it effectively bridges the gap between the 1953 classic and modern audiences.

4. Peter Pan (2003)

Millennials of a certain age definitely fawned over Jeremy Sumpter in this live-action retelling—and for good reason. But teen crushes aside, the 2003 Peter Pan is arguably the best straight adaptation of the novel. Sumpter captures Peter’s mischievous, slightly alien nature perfectly. At the same time, Jason Isaacs pulls double duty as Mr. Darling and Hook, adding a layer of psychological depth often missed in other versions. The chemistry between the leads makes this a faithful, visually stunning standout.

3. Hook (1991)

Steven Spielberg’s Hook imagines a world where Peter Pan grew up and forgot his magic. Robin Williams stars as the hero-turned-lawyer who must return to Neverland to save his children. Dustin Hoffman is unrecognizable and electric as the infamous Captain Hook, while the tangible, cluttered set design makes the world feel completely unique. It’s a nostalgia bomb for ’90s kids, celebrating the idea that growing up is an awfully big adventure in itself. And trust me, Hook definitely takes on a different meaning when you rewatch this as an adult.

2. Finding Neverland (2004)

Technically, Finding Neverland isn’t a direct adaptation of the Boy Who Wouldn’t Grow Up. Instead, it’s a beautiful tale about the creation of the story, following playwright J.M. Barrie as he befriends a widow and her four children. Johnny Depp delivers a tender performance as Barrie, grounded by Kate Winslet’s heartbreaking turn as the boys’ mother. It’s a tear-jerker that focuses less on pirates and fairies and more on the power of storytelling to heal grief.

1. Peter Pan (1953)

The classic animated film from Disney’s Silver Age is cherished by many. While some aspects are offensive and outdated (there’s a whole Disney+ disclaimer for that), there’s still much to love about this dazzling adventure. It defined the look of Peter, Tinker Bell, and Captain Hook for decades, establishing the iconography we all know today. The animation remains vibrant, the songs are still earworms, and the cultural footprint is massive—spanning theme park rides, a series of Tinker Bell prequels, and beyond.

Peter Pan movies ranked FAQ

How many Peter Pan movies are there?

There are dozens of adaptations of J.M. Barrie's story, but the most prominent include Disney's 1953 animated classic, the 2003 live-action film, and Steven Spielberg's Hook. Counting TV movies, specials, and unofficial adaptations, the number exceeds 30 films.

Is Hook a sequel to Peter Pan?

Yes, Hook (1991) serves as a spiritual sequel to the original story. It explores what happens after Peter Pan leaves Neverland and finally grows up. He becomes a high-powered lawyer named Peter Banning, having forgotten his magical childhood until Captain Hook returns to kidnap his children.

What is the best Peter Pan movie?

While this is subjective, the 2003 live-action Peter Pan is often cited by critics and fans as the most faithful and well-acted adaptation. But Disney's 1953 animated film remains the most culturally iconic version of the character.

Related articles

  • What To Watch on Disney+
  • Hulu Bundles
  • Best Animated Horror Movies

The post 8 Peter Pan Movies Ranked: From “Hook” to The Classics appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: Verizon Is Giving Away Free Samsung Smart TVs This Week!
item.dc:creator: Logan Jones
item.description:
Stop overpaying! CableTV.com's deals expert finds the week's deepest internet, TV, and mobile deals & discounts. Get exclusive, updated savings you won't find anywhere else.

The post Verizon Is Giving Away Free Samsung Smart TVs This Week! appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Finding the best internet, TV, and mobile deals can be super overwhelming. Trust me, I know: Half of my job is hunting down the best deals, combing through disclaimers for expiration dates, and sifting through other fine print to uncover the details of the best current promos for all the top telco and streaming services.
That’s why I’ve started this weekly column to keep readers up-to-date with the best deals that providers are currently running. This page is updated weekly with a fresh batch of deals released over the past week, so be sure to bookmark it for future reference.

✦ Allow me to introduce myself! My name is Logan Jones, and I’ve been CableTV.com’s resident deals expert for close to three years. As part of the editorial staff, it’s my job to keep readers updated with all the latest internet, TV, and mobile promotions. I update all 20+ of our deals pages at the beginning of each month, and keep an eye out for new promos as they drop.

Wanna keep up with the top deals and entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter to get updated on the latest money-saving promotions, TV-viewing guides, and entertaining takes.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

Verizon can hook you up with a free TV 📺

Who doesn’t love free stuff? Verizon knows that (and has the budget to back it up), as they’re the go-to provider for scoring free tech—think smart TVs, tablets, and gaming consoles.

Right now, Verizon’s offering up either a free 43″ Class Q7F QLED Samsung TV or a free Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE 5G tablet for new Verizon home internet customers who sign up for eligible plans. So if you’ve been eyeing an upgrade, now would be the perfect time to snag some shiny new tech at no cost.

Keep reading to see which Verizon internet plans get you the freebies—plus some other perks Verizon is offering up.

Check out all of the current promos from top providers

Click on your internet, TV, or streaming service of choice to find all the best provider-specific deals updated monthly.

How to claim your free smart TV or tablet before February 4

Before I get you too excited, just be aware that not every Verizon Fios fiber internet plan is eligible for free TVs or tablets.

If you want Fios 300 or 500 Mbps, you won’t get the choice of the 43″ Class Q7F QLED Samsung TV or the Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE 5G, although you’ll still get a three-year price guarantee and exceptionally reliable internet service.

To get free Samsung tech with Verizon Fios fiber internet, you’ll need to sign up for the Fios 1 Gig or Fios 2 Gig plans.

Even if you don’t live in a Verizon Fios fiber service area, you may still be able to get this deal, since Verizon is also offering these same freebies with their more widely available 5G Home Ultimate internet plan.

View Verizon Plans

Looking for even more deals?

Best TV Deals This Month
Best Internet Deals This Month

Some things never change…

While some providers tend to switch out deals on the reg, others like to keep things more stable (which I appreciate, seeing as I personally update all 20+ of our deals pages each month😅).

Here are some of the best perpetual deals from top TV and internet providers:

  • Amazon Prime Video: 30-day free trial
  • DIRECTV: HBO Max, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, MGM+, CINEMAX, STARZ included for 3 mos.
  • DISH: Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, STARZ, and DISH Movie Pack included for 3 mos.
  • Hulu: 30-day free trial
  • Verizon: Up to $200 in gift cards with Verizon’s Fios TV plans
  • Xfinity: Get an Unlimited line included for a year with a 300 Mbps or faster Xfinity Internet plan
« See Last Week's Deals

item.title: Is the Green Bay Packers Game on Prime Video Tonight?
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
Can you watch the Packers game without Prime Video? Check our guide for local channel listings (Green Bay & Milwaukee) and the full Wild Card schedule.

The post Is the Green Bay Packers Game on Prime Video Tonight? appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Managing Editor Mike Strayer, our editorial lead with over 10 years of experience covering TV and sports.

The Green Bay Packers at the Chicago Bears Wild Card Weekend game kicks off Saturday, January 10, 2026, at 7:00 p.m. CT (8:00 p.m. ET) and will stream exclusively on Amazon Prime Video.

Yes, this exciting NFC North rivalry game will be broadcast exclusively on Prime Video, so it won’t air on cable channels or local affiliates like ESPN, ABC, or CBS with one (well, more like three) exception(s). More on that to come.

Where can I watch the Packers Game?

If you don’t have (or want) Prime Video, you can still watch the game live on one of your local TV stations if you live in the Green Bay, Milwaukee, or Chicago TV markets.

Platform Status Details
Prime Video ✔ Exclusive national broadcaster. Requires Prime membership or standalone sub.
Green Bay Local TV ✔ Broadcast on NBC 26 in the Green Bay area.
Milwaukee Local TV ✔ Broadcast on FOX 6 in the Milwaukee area.
Chicago Local TV ✔ Available on FOX 32 in the Chicago TV market.
NFL+ Mobile only Livestreaming on cell phones and tablets only (no casting to TV).
Peacock — Peacock has the Chargers vs. Patriots game this weekend, not the Packers game.
Paramount+ — Paramount+ has the Bills vs. Jaguars game this weekend, not the Packers game.

Quick guide: How to get Prime Video

For most Packers fans living outside of Wisconsin, Prime Video is the only way to watch this playoff game.

  • Cost: Included with Amazon Prime ($14.99/mo.) or as a standalone video subscription for $8.99/mo.
  • Free trial: 30 Days (available for new subscribers).
  • Key feature: Select “Record” to watch the game later if you can’t watch live (DVR functionality included).
  • How to watch: Open the Prime Video app on your Smart TV, Roku, Fire TV, or game console and look for the “NFL” banner on the homepage.

The post Is the Green Bay Packers Game on Prime Video Tonight? appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: Jeremy Allen White’s 11 Best Roles: From “The Bear” to “Shameless”
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
From Chef Carmy in The Bear to Lip Gallagher in Shameless, we review the absolute best Jeremy Allen White roles. See where your favorite movie or series landed.

The post Jeremy Allen White’s 11 Best Roles: From “The Bear” to “Shameless” appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Senior Staff Writer Randy Harward.

Jeremy Allen White has made a name for himself with a resume full of intense, compelling characters spanning film and television. Today, I’m reviewing his best projects to date.

Of course, there are many reasons why White’s made a pop culture splash. He’s a captivating actor who often carries an aura of calm intensity that draws you in immediately. There’s also something about him being a “hot rodent man.” But I won’t get into that right now. Instead, let’s focus on the performances that cement him as one of Hollywood’s most exciting talents.

In the video below, we highlighted our top four picks. But I’ve expanded the list here with seven more essential roles, including his blockbuster transformation into the legendary Bruce Springsteen and some hidden gems you might’ve missed.

Watch our original recommendations on TikTok!

1. The Bear (2022–present)

Nothing in Jeremy Allen White’s filmography tops The Bear. It’s an anxiety-inducing series headlined by White’s earnest and nuanced acting ability as Carmen “Carmy” Berzatto. His portrayal of a world-class chef returning to run his family’s chaotic sandwich shop is a masterclass in tension and vulnerability, earning him multiple Emmy and Golden Globe awards. If you only watch one thing on this list, make it this stressful, beautiful culinary drama.

2. The Iron Claw (2023)

White’s performance in The Iron Claw tells the Von Erich family story with haunting authenticity. Playing Kerry Von Erich, he underwent a massive physical transformation to embody the “Texas Tornado,” delivering a performance that is as heartbreaking as it is physically impressive. The film explores the tragic “curse” that plagued the legendary wrestling dynasty, and White stands out even among a stellar cast including Zac Efron.

3. Shameless (2011–2021)

White’s breakout role came in this long-running Showtime series, where he played the complex genius Lip Gallagher. For over a decade, fans watched him navigate poverty, addiction, and giftedness with a raw realism that anchored the show’s chaotic energy. It’s the role that introduced him to the world and confirmed that he could handle a character arc spanning nearly his entire young adult life.

4. Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere (2025)

In one of his most ambitious roles yet, White steps into the shoes of The Boss himself, Bruce Springsteen. This biopic chronicles the making of the seminal album Nebraska, with White capturing the musician’s introspection and artistic struggle during a pivotal moment in his career. It’s a quieter, more internal performance that pairs perfectly with his co-star Jeremy Strong (as manager/producer Jon Landau), proving White can handle the weight of playing a living legend.

5. Fremont (2023)

White has minimal screen time in this contemplative tale, but he brings an impactful presence to his scenes as Daniel, a lonely mechanic. The film follows an Afghan refugee working at a fortune cookie factory, and White’s character offers a gentle, tender connection that serves as a pivotal emotional beat in the story. It’s a testament to his ability to leave a lasting impression even when he’s not the center of attention.

6. The Rental (2020)

Before he was a chef or a wrestler, White played Josh in this tense horror-thriller directed by Dave Franco. The film follows two couples on a weekend getaway that goes wrong, and White plays the erratic brother whose secrets help fuel the group’s paranoia. It’s a great example of his skill in playing characters on the edge, adding a layer of unpredictability to a classic slasher setup.

7. Fingernails (2023)

In this sci-fi romance, White plays Ryan, a man in a “certified” happy relationship that might not be as perfect as the tests say. Starring alongside Jessie Buckley and Riz Ahmed, White delivers a subdued performance as a partner trying to maintain a connection in a world where love is scientifically measured. It’s a quirky, melancholy role that’s a nice change of pace from White’s typical gritty dramas.

8. Homecoming (2018)

If you missed him in Amazon’s psychological thriller series Homecoming, go back and watch his turn as Shrier, a soldier struggling with the transition back to civilian life. Appearing in the first season alongside Julia Roberts, White captures the paranoia and confusion of a man who suspects the facility meant to help him isn’t what it seems. It’s a smaller role, but his acting power sells the mystery right from the start.

9. Afterschool (2008)

Capturing a cold, detached atmosphere that seemed common in late-2000s indie cinema, Afterschool is an unsettling watch. This psychological drama explores the dark side of digital voyeurism at an elite prep school, dripping with a creepy, artsy tension that gets under your skin. In one of his earliest film roles, White plays the roommate of the disturbed protagonist, delivering a grounded performance that anchors the film’s suffocating sense of dread.

10. Bad Turn Worse (2013)

White leans into the crime thriller genre as Bobby in this tense “Texas noir” about three teens who steal money from the wrong people. When they’re caught by a local gangster, they’re forced into a dangerous heist to pay off their debt, spiraling into a situation that only gets worse. The chemistry between the leads is palpable, and White perfectly captures the desperation of a kid way over his head.

11. Rob the Mob (2014)

Based on a true story, this crime dramedy features White in a supporting role as Robert, part of a larger ensemble cast including Andy Garcia and Ray Romano. The film follows a couple who target mafia social clubs for heists, stumbling onto secrets that put them in the crosshairs of both the mob and the FBI. It’s a fun, breezy watch compared to his heavier dramas, showcasing his ability to fit seamlessly into a period piece.

Jeremy Allen White roles FAQ

What is Jeremy Allen White's most famous role?

Jeremy Allen White is most famous for playing Carmen "Carmy" Berzatto in the hit series The Bear and Philip "Lip" Gallagher in the long-running Showtime drama Shameless.

Did Jeremy Allen White play Bruce Springsteen?

Yes, Jeremy Allen White portrayed Bruce Springsteen in the 2025 biopic Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere, which focuses on the creation of the Nebraska album.

How many Emmys has Jeremy Allen White won?

As of 2026, Jeremy Allen White has won two Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series for his role in The Bear.

Related articles

  • What To Watch on Disney+
  • TV Shows Like The Bear
  • The Best TV Shows of 2025

The post Jeremy Allen White’s 11 Best Roles: From “The Bear” to “Shameless” appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: Shows Like “Reacher”: 8 Series To Watch if You Love Action
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
Waiting for Reacher Season 4? From The Terminal List to Banshee, here are eight shows like Reacher to keep your adrenaline pumping in the meantime.

The post Shows Like “Reacher”: 8 Series To Watch if You Love Action appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Senior Staff Writer Randy Harward.

We’re officially back in the waiting game. While Reacher Season 3 is behind us and Season 4 has already wrapped production, we’re stuck in that quiet window before Alan Ritchson returns to our screens to break more bones. (Though we’ll probably see him sooner, as the Neagley spin-off series should drop before Season 4 to tide us over.)

To pass the time until our favorite swole drifter returns, I’ve rounded up the best shows that echo Reacher‘s unique blend of mystery and muscle. Whether you’re looking for military-grade tactics, small-town justice, or just a hyper-competent hero taking down bad guys, I’ve got you covered. In the video below, we highlighted our top four picks, but I’ve expanded the list here with four more high-octane thrillers to keep your adrenaline pumping.

Watch our original recommendations on TikTok!

1. Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan (2018–2023)

Join Tom Clancy’s renowned CIA agent turned operative as he tackles global threats and espionage. It’s not saying much, but John Krasinski is the best Jack Ryan since Harrison Ford. While Reacher focuses on domestic road-trip justice, Jack Ryan takes the action global with high-stakes geopolitical thrillers that will keep you on the edge of your seat. If you love seeing a hyper-competent hero solve problems with both his brain and his brawn, this Prime Video series is the natural next step.

2. Justified (2010–2015)

Dive into the world of Deputy U.S. Marshal Raylan Givens as he faces off against dangerous criminals in this gripping modern western. Like Reacher, Givens is a lawman who plays by his own rules and isn’t afraid to draw his weapon when the situation calls for it. The dialogue is sharper than a switchblade, and the Kentucky setting provides a rich, gritty backdrop for some of the best crime storytelling in television history.

3. Bosch (2014–2021)

Like Reacher and Jack Ryan, Bosch is another Prime Video series worth checking out. It follows LAPD detective Harry Bosch, who investigates intricate cases and navigates the complexities of the justice system. There’s a reason why this is Amazon’s longest-running series; Titus Welliver’s portrayal of the stoic, jazz-loving detective is mesmerizing. It’s a slower burn than Reacher, but the meticulous detective work and uncompromising moral code will feel right at home.

4. The Punisher (2017–2019)

Sure, it’s a Marvel series, but The Punisher is compelling and full of action-packed scenarios you won’t want to miss. Jon Bernthal plays Frank Castle, a former Marine out to punish the criminals responsible for his family’s murder. It shares Reacher’s DNA of a military man unearthing a conspiracy and dealing with it through extreme prejudice. It’s brutal, emotional, and features some of the best tactical combat sequences on TV.

5. The Terminal List (2022–present)

If the military revenge plot was your favorite part of Reacher, Chris Pratt’s The Terminal List needs to be next in your queue. Pratt stars as a Navy SEAL commander who returns home from a botched mission only to find a conspiracy working against him. It’s darker and grittier than Reacher, trading swagger for a claustrophobic intensity as he methodically dismantles the people who betrayed his team. (Bonus: The prequel series, The Terminal List: Dark Wolf, dropped in late 2025, so there is plenty of tactical action to binge.)

6. Banshee (2013–2016)

Imagine if Reacher stayed in one town and became the sheriff—that’s essentially the vibe you get with Banshee. An ex-con assumes the identity of a murdered sheriff in a small Amish town, dispensing his own brand of violent justice while hiding from a powerful crime lord. The fight choreography is visceral and bone-crunching, arguably setting the bar for modern action TV. If you watch Reacher for the brawls, Banshee is required viewing.

7. The Night Agent (2023–present)

For fans of the conspiracy unraveling in Reacher, The Night Agent offers a fast-paced thriller about a low-level FBI agent who answers a phone that never rings. When it finally does, he’s propelled into a dangerous conspiracy involving a mole at the White House. It balances character drama with explosive action, making it perfect for a weekend binge-watch.

Shows Like Reacher FAQ

What show is most similar to Reacher?

Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan and The Terminal List are often considered the most similar shows to Reacher. Both are Amazon Prime Video originals that feature highly skilled military or intelligence operatives solving massive conspiracies, often outside the standard chain of command.

Is there a spin-off series for Reacher?

Yes! A spin-off series titled Neagley is currently in post-production. It focuses on fan-favorite character Frances Neagley (Maria Sten). Filming wrapped in June 2025, so we expect it to hit Prime Video sometime this year, possibly before Reacher Season 4.

Are there other shows based on Lee Child's books?

No other TV shows are currently based on Lee Child's Jack Reacher novels. But there were two feature films starring Tom Cruise (Jack Reacher and Jack Reacher: Never Go Back) that cover different books in the series, if you want to see a different (shorter) take on the character.

Related articles

  • What To Watch on Amazon Prime Video
  • How To Binge-Watch a Show in One Weekend
  • Amazon Prime Video vs. Netflix

The post Shows Like “Reacher”: 8 Series To Watch if You Love Action appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: Is the Chicago Bears Wild Card Game on Prime Video Tonight?
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
Can you watch the Bears game without Prime Video? Check our guide for local channel listings (Chicago & Green Bay) and the full Wild Card schedule.

The post Is the Chicago Bears Wild Card Game on Prime Video Tonight? appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Managing Editor Mike Strayer, our editorial lead with over 10 years of experience covering TV and sports.

The Bears vs. Packers Wild Card Weekend game kicks off Saturday, January 10, 2026, at 7:00 p.m. CT (8:00 p.m. ET).

This NFC North playoff battle will be broadcast nationally by Amazon Prime Video.

That means you can’t watch it on cable or local affiliate channels like ESPN, ABC, or CBS—unless you live in Chicago or parts of Wisconsin (more on that below).

Where can I watch the Bears Wild Card game?

If you don’t have (or want) Prime Video, your options are limited unless you live in the local Chicago or Wisconsin TV markets.

Platform Status Details
Prime Video ✔ Exclusive national broadcaster. Requires an Amazon Prime membership or standalone sub.
Local Chicago TV ✔ Available on FOX 32 in the Chicago TV market.
Local Wisconsin TV ✔ Available on NBC 26 in the Green Bay TV market and FOX 6 in the Milwaukee TV market.
NFL+ Mobile only Livestreaming on mobile phones and tablets only (no casting to TV).
Peacock — Peacock has the Chargers vs. Patriots game this weekend, not the Bears game.
Paramount+ — Paramount+ has the Bills vs. Jaguars game this weekend, not the Bears game.

Quick guide: How to get Prime Video

For most fans outside of Chicago and Wisconsin, Prime Video is the only way to watch this historic playoff rivalry.

  • Cost: Included with Amazon Prime ($14.99/mo.) or as a standalone video subscription for $8.99/mo.
  • Free trial: 30 Days (available for new subscribers).
  • Key feature: Use “X-Ray” during the game to see real-time stats, replays, and player info by pressing up on your remote.
  • How to watch: Open the Prime Video app on your Smart TV, Roku, Fire TV, or game console and look for the “NFL” banner on the homepage.

The post Is the Chicago Bears Wild Card Game on Prime Video Tonight? appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: 11 Best ’90s Goosebumps Episodes Ranked: Slappy, Evil Masks, and More
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
From The Haunted Mask to Ryan Gosling, we rank the best Goosebumps episodes of the '90s. See which spooky classics from the original TV series made our top 11.

The post 11 Best ’90s Goosebumps Episodes Ranked: Slappy, Evil Masks, and More appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Sports Editor Taylor Kujawa, our resident TV expert with over eight years of covering sports and entertainment.

“You can run, but you cannot hide.” If that line from the Goosebumps intro doesn’t trigger a Pavlovian fear response, you probably weren’t watching TV in the ’90s.

R.L. Stine’s children’s horror books were a rite of passage for an entire generation, and the TV adaptation brought those nightmares to life with practical effects that still (mostly) hold up today.

In the video below, we highlighted our top four picks of the best Goosebumps episodes. But I’ve expanded the list to include 11 of the most iconic, terrifying, and campy episodes, perfect for a spooky season rewatch.

Watch our original recommendations on TikTok!

11. “Attack of the Jack-O’-Lanterns” (1996)

If you’re watching Goosebumps for Halloween, you can’t skip this one. Drew and her friends are terrorized by pumpkin-headed figures on Halloween night, leading to a bizarre and colorful climax. It’s extremely campy and features some questionable choices in the alien subplot. But the visuals of the pumpkin heads walking through the suburbs are undeniably iconic to the franchise.

10. “The Girl Who Cried Monster” (1995)

Because Lucy loves telling scary stories, no one believes her when she discovers the local librarian is actually a monster. This episode features one of the grossest scenes in the Goosebumps series (the librarian eating bugs) and a classic R.L. Stine twist ending that flips the script on who the real monsters are. It’s a fun, slimy entry that perfectly balances humor and horror.

9. “A Night in Terror Tower” (1996)

Transporting viewers to London, this two-part special locks siblings Sue and Eddie in a medieval torture chamber. It features executioners, time travel, and a genuinely hopeless atmosphere that sets it apart from the suburban horror of other episodes. This provides a fun break from the usual formula, even if the “sorcerer” special effects look a bit dated today.

8. “One Day at HorrorLand” (1997)

When the Morris family gets lost and stumbles upon a theme park run by “Horrors,” they encounter a series of deadly rides and games. This two-part episode captures the surreal, nightmarish feeling of being trapped in a place that looks fun but might actually kill you. As one of the most adventurous Goosebumps episodes, it features a full cast of monsters and a wild game show finale.

7. “The Werewolf of Fever Swamp” (1996)

This Goosebumps episode really plays up some classic monster movie tropes, following a boy named Grady who suspects a werewolf is lurking in the swamp near his new home. It features a memorable foggy, moonlit setting and a twist that reaffirms you can’t always judge a book by its cover. It’s a great introduction to werewolf lore for younger viewers.

6. “Stay Out of the Basement” (1996)

Based on the second book in the Goosebumps series, this two-parter deals with a father who spends way too much time in the basement with his plants. When he starts eating plant food and bleeding green goop, his kids realize he might not be their dad after all. It’s a fantastic body-horror concept for children, featuring some great practical creature effects that are equal parts gross and cool.

5. “Welcome to Dead House” (1997)

Often cited by Goosebumps fans as the scariest episode of the entire run, “Welcome to Dead House” narrates the story of the Benson family moving to a town where the residents are a little too quiet. It’s essentially a zombie tale disguised as a kids’ show, with the townspeople needing fresh blood (note: not brains) to sustain themselves. The dark tone and lack of campy humor make it a standout for those who want actual chills.

4. “The Scarecrow Walks at Midnight” (1996)

I would be remiss if I didn’t mention “The Scarecrow Walks at Midnight,” with its ultra-creepy scarecrow character designs. This episode, plus Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark, fueled my generation’s fear of hay-stuffed monsters. When siblings Jodie and Mark visit their grandparents’ farm, they find the fields overrun by silent, twitching scarecrows that seem to be alive. The isolation of the rural setting makes this one of the tensest entries in the series.

3. “Say Cheese and Die” (1996)

The book is iconic, and the TV episode is picture-perfect for suspense lovers. It also stars a young Ryan Gosling, a year after he appeared in Are You Afraid of the Dark? Gosling plays Greg, who finds a cursed camera that predicts (or causes) bad things to happen to the people in the photos. Watching a future Oscar nominee scream “Stupid camera!” is worth the price of admission alone.

2. “Night of the Living Dummy II” (1996)

Let’s face it: Slappy the ventriloquist dummy was way more sinister in the ’90s TV series than in the Jack Black Goosebumps movies. This episode marks Slappy’s TV debut (skipping the first book’s plot) and features him tormenting Amy Kramer and her family with cruel pranks. The practical effects of Slappy moving on his own are genuinely unnerving, solidifying him as the franchise’s mascot.

1. “The Haunted Mask” (1995)

Taking our top spot is the series premiere that traumatized a generation. While the “mask-fusing-to-your-face” trope appears often in horror, this episode stands out because of Carly Beth’s innocent-to-wicked transformation. As she uses the creepy mask to scare her bullies, her voice changes, and she becomes increasingly aggressive. It results in a surprisingly psychological horror story for kids that remains the highest-rated episode on IMDb.

Best Goosebumps episodes FAQ

What is the scariest episode of Goosebumps?

While opinions vary, "The Haunted Mask" and "Welcome to Dead House" are consistently ranked among the scariest Goosebumps episodes. Both have a darker tone and genuine jump scares. "The Haunted Mask" deals with psychological horror, while "Welcome to Dead House" features zombie-like creatures.

Is Ryan Gosling in Goosebumps?

Yes! A young Ryan Gosling stars in the Season 1 episode "Say Cheese and Die" as the main character, Greg Banks. He also appeared in the equally iconic Are You Afraid of the Dark? series a year earlier.

Which Goosebumps episodes have Slappy?

Slappy the Dummy makes his first TV appearance in "Night of the Living Dummy II". He returns in "Night of the Living Dummy III" and "Bride of the Living Dummy."

Related articles

  • How To Watch the Goosebumps Shows and Movies
  • The Best Animated Horror Movies
  • What To Watch on Disney+

The post 11 Best ’90s Goosebumps Episodes Ranked: Slappy, Evil Masks, and More appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: Want Free Streaming? Save Money in 2026 With This Week’s Handpicked Deals
item.dc:creator: Logan Jones
item.description:
Stop overpaying! CableTV.com's deals expert finds the week's deepest internet, TV, and mobile deals & discounts. Get exclusive, updated savings you won't find anywhere else.

The post Want Free Streaming? Save Money in 2026 With This Week’s Handpicked Deals appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Finding the best internet, TV, and mobile deals can be super overwhelming. Trust me, I know: Half of my job is hunting down the best deals, combing through disclaimers for expiration dates, and sifting through other fine print to uncover the details of the best current promos for all the top telco and streaming services.
That’s why I’ve started this weekly column to keep readers up-to-date with the best deals that providers are currently running. This page is updated weekly with a fresh batch of deals released over the past week, so be sure to bookmark it for future reference.

✦ Allow me to introduce myself! My name is Logan Jones, and I’ve been CableTV.com’s resident deals expert for close to three years. As part of the editorial staff, it’s my job to keep readers updated with all the latest internet, TV, and mobile promotions. I update all 20+ of our deals pages at the beginning of each month, and keep an eye out for new promos as they drop.

Wanna keep up with the top deals and entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter to get updated on the latest money-saving promotions, TV-viewing guides, and entertaining takes.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

Looking to stream for free in 2026?

For my first deals column of the new year, I crowdsourced my friends and colleagues to understand the biggest pain points in their spending lives. And, wouldn’t you know it, one issue that cropped up a lot was streaming services.

Now is not the time to wax poetic about how streaming services dominated cable TV, only to basically turn into cable themselves. But, TL;DR, streaming fatigue is hitting everyone.

That’s why I’ve made this week’s column all about the best streaming deals—aka how to get free streaming services—to go ahead and tick off the “save money” to-do on your 2026 New Year’s resolution list.

Check out all of the current promos from top providers

Click on your internet, TV, or streaming service of choice to find all the best provider-specific deals updated monthly.

The best free streaming TV deals

The best things in life typically don’t come for free, but that doesn’t mean you can’t still find some free streaming services out there, if you know where to look.

Below, I’ve compiled the best promos currently running that are serving up some totally free streaming services.

Some deals last for a limited time, but a few are offering certain streaming services for free indefinitely. Be sure to click the provider links in the bullets below to get all the details.

  • DIRECTV: HBO Max, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, MGM+, CINEMAX, STARZ included for 3 mos.
  • DISH: Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, STARZ, and DISH Movie Pack included for 3 mos.
  • Optimum: Get Netflix Standard with ads included at no cost for 12 mos. when you sign up for an Optimum internet plan with 500 Mbps or higher.
  • Spectrum: Get Disney+ Basic, Hulu, ESPN Unlimited, HBO Max with Ads, Peacock Premium, AMC+, Paramount+ Essential, VIX Premium with Ads, and FOX One included at no cost with Spectrum TV® Select Signature.
  • T-Mobile 5G Home Internet: Get Hulu (With Ads) and the Paramount+ Essential Plan included with T-Mobile All-In Internet.
  • T-Mobile Wireless: Netflix Standard with ads is included with T-Mobile’s Experience plans.

Pro tip: Another great way to get truly free TV is through streaming service free trials. Luckily, my colleague Olivia Bono wrote an in-depth guide to the best on-demand and live TV streaming trials.

Looking for even more deals?

Best TV Deals This Month
Best Internet Deals This Month

Some things never change…

While some providers tend to switch out deals on the reg, others like to keep things more stable (which I appreciate, seeing as I personally update all 20+ of our deals pages each month😅).

Here are some of the best perpetual deals from top TV and internet providers:

  • Amazon Prime Video: 30-day free trial
  • Hulu: 30-day free trial
  • Verizon: Up to $200 in gift cards with Verizon’s Fios TV plans
  • Xfinity: Get an Unlimited line included for a year with a 300 Mbps or faster Xfinity Internet plan
« See Last Week's Deals

The post Want Free Streaming? Save Money in 2026 With This Week’s Handpicked Deals appeared first on CableTV.com.
